definition: (bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known

sentences.english: The Yarlung Zangbo River, which is one of the main rivers in the region, is 2057 km long.
sentences.chinese: 主要河流之一的雅鲁藏布江长2057公里。

sentences.english: This is the first report of Triassic Radiolaria within the Yarlung-Zangbo Suture Zone.
sentences.chinese: 这是雅鲁藏布江缝合带三叠纪放射虫的首次报告。
顺雅鲁藏布江逆流而上，是日喀则。

sentences.english: Yarlung Zangbo rift is a suture line between the colliding plates.
sentences.chinese: 雅鲁藏布江断裂是举世闻名的缝合线。

sentences.english: Tanggula Mountains to the south of the Brahmaputra is famous.
sentences.chinese: 唐古拉山以南，就是赫赫有名的雅鲁藏布江。

sentences.english: Is a tributary of the Brahmaputra's largest.
sentences.chinese: 是雅鲁藏布江最大的一条支流。

sentences.english: The major technical constraints on damming the Yarlung Tsampo have been overcome.
sentences.chinese: 在雅鲁藏布江上修建水坝的技术难题已经被攻克。

sentences.english: Brahmaputra river is known as as Yarlung Zangbo in China.
sentences.chinese: 布拉马特拉河在中国境内被称为雅鲁藏布江。
雅鲁藏布江能拯救中国吗？

sentences.english: The upper reaches of the Yarlung Zangbo River lie in a frigid zone.
sentences.chinese: 雅鲁藏布江的上游是高寒地带。

definition: Great Canyon of Yarlung Tsangpo-Brahmaputra (through the southeast Himalayas, from Tibet to Assam and Bangladesh)
pinyin: Ya3 lu3 zang4 bu4 Da4 xia2 gu3

definition: Dangla or Tanggula mountain range on the Qinhai-Tibet plateau
Dangla or Tanggula mountain range on the Qinhai-Tibet plateau
Nyingchi prefecture of Tibet, Tibetan: Nying khri sa khul, Chinese Linzhi
Nyang qu or Nian chu River in Tibet, a tributary of Yarlung Tsangpo
Gangdisê mountain range in southwest Tibet

pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4

definition: source of Changjiang or Yangtze river
Mt Gangdisê (6656m) in southwest Tibet, revered by Tibetans as the center of the universe
Yalong river of Tibet and Sichuan
